body.p:
Louisville Feby 27th 1861 --
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govr. of Kentucky

At the request of the friends of the petitioner Wm. Frooks & the Keeper of the workhouse Mr Horner -- I am induced to make the following statement of facts, for Executive consideration -- In April 1860 -- an Indictment was returned to the city court in the name of the Comth of Kentucky vs Wm. Frooks for an assault & Battery made returnable to the first Monday in May 1860 -- the Deft was recog
=nized in the sum of $100 -- with one security to appear and answer sd. charge the Deft & his Bail appeared in court on the day of the trial & Deft was tried & fined $5=00, his Bail says by some mistake or gross wrong -- the Recognizance was forfeited vs Deft & Bail -- Deft was at the time employed as a hand on a coal boat destined for the South & left the day of the trial but returned several times between the trial day & the time of his arrest which was on the 28th Jany 1861 -- he had landed late the night
before and at breakfast time next morning was taken into custody -- at the instance of his Bail, (Conally) to whom he pd. $40 -- which was all the money he had & that was pd over to the officers for fees -- the remainder was remitted by yr Excellency -- this man has been in the workhouse about One month his friends would pay the costs if yr Excellency will remit his fine -- this seems the effect of ignorance on his part or mistake on the part of others which may well claim Executive clemency with great respect yr obt servt

Louisville City Ct
$100 } Recog
Wm Frooks
Issd Mar 2 1861
